q1.question:
Identify the system call you should use to accomplish the following tasks:

  1. Send a signal to a process.
  2. Create a new process.
  3. Replace current process image with a new process image.
  4. Retrieve the exit status of a child process.
  5. Terminate current process.

q2.question: Which of the following statements regarding fork and exec are true (select all that apply)?

responses.parent: After a <tt>fork()</tt>, the parent gets the <tt>PID</tt> of the child process.
responses.child: After a <tt>fork()</tt>, the child gets the <tt>PID</tt> of itself.
responses.process: After a <tt>fork()</tt>, the parent and child processes are nearly identical.
responses.perror: During a <tt>fork()</tt>, the parent is terminated if there is an error.
responses.pfirst: After a <tt>fork()</tt>, the parent is guaranteed to run first.
responses.cfirst: After a <tt>fork()</tt>, the child is guaranteed to run first.
responses.scheduler: After a <tt>fork()</tt>, the next process to run is determined by the scheduler.
responses.create: After an <tt>exec()</tt>, a new process is created.
responses.load: After an <tt>exec()</tt>, new program code is loaded.
responses.before: You must always call <tt>fork()</tt> before you call <tt>exec()</tt>.
responses.after: You must always call <tt>exec()</tt> after you call <tt>fork()</tt>.
